labels.analysis: The MCP (Multiagent Communication Protocol) demo server is designed to showcase basic interaction with MCP clients, primarily serving as an implementation example. Its core functionality revolves around demonstrating MCP protocol usage, acting as both a learning tool and a foundation for more complex MCP server development. The single available tool ("hello") suggests basic interaction capabilities for protocol demonstration purposes.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Communication Tools" was chosen because the MCP protocol itself is fundamentally about agent communication. While it doesn't have advanced features of communication servers, its demonstration role makes it most appropriate for this category. No secondary labels are needed as the functionality is quite focused, and no custom label is required as the predefined categories cover the essential aspects.
labels.custom_label: No secondary labels needed for this basic demo server

server_info_crawled.name: mcp-demo
server_info_crawled.author: @nssachin/mcp-demo
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide a simple demonstration of an MCP server implementation. Enable basic interaction with MCP clients to showcase protocol usage. Serve as a starting point for building more complex MCP servers.
